item.title: Vo1d malware botnet grows to 1.6 million Android TVs worldwide
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new variant of the Vo1d malware botnet has grown to 1,590,299 infected Android TV devices across 226 countries, recruiting devices as part of anonymous proxy server networks. [...]

item.title: Privacy tech firms warn France’s encryption and VPN laws threaten privacy
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Privacy-focused email provider Tuta (previously Tutanota) and the VPN Trust Initiative (VTI) are raising concerns over proposed laws in France set to backdoor encrypted messaging systems and restrict internet access. [...]

item.title: Microsoft names cybercriminals behind AI deepfake network
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has named multiple threat actors part of a cybercrime gang accused of developing malicious tools capable of bypassing generative AI guardrails to generate celebrity deepfakes and other illicit content. [...]

item.title: Over 49,000 misconfigured building access systems exposed online
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Researchers discovered 49,000 misconfigured and exposed Access Management Systems (AMS) across multiple industries and countries, which could compromise privacy and physical security in critical sectors. [...]

item.title: Belgium probes if Chinese hackers breached its intelligence service
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​The Belgian federal prosecutor's office is investigating whether Chinese hackers were behind a breach of the country's State Security Service (VSSE). [...]

item.title: Suspected Desorden hacker arrested for breaching 90 organizations
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A suspected cyber criminal believed to have extorted companies under the name "DESORDEN Group" or "ALTDOS" has been arrested in Thailand for leaking the stolen data of over 90 organizations worldwide. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes Outlook drag-and-drop broken by Windows updates
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has fixed a known issue that broke email and calendar drag-and-drop in classic Outlook after installing recent updates on Windows 24H2 systems. [...]

item.title: FBI confirms Lazarus hackers were behind $1.5B Bybit crypto heist
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: FBI has confirmed that North Korean hackers stole $1.5 billion from cryptocurrency exchange Bybit on Friday in the largest crypto heist recorded until now. [...]

item.title: Southern Water says Black Basta ransomware attack cost £4.5M in expenses
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: United Kingdom water supplier Southern Water has disclosed that it incurred costs of £4.5 million ($5.7M) due to a cyberattack it suffered in February 2024. [...]

item.title: GrassCall malware campaign drains crypto wallets via fake job interviews
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A recent social engineering campaign targeted job seekers in the Web3 space with fake job interviews through a malicious "GrassCall" meeting app that installs information-stealing malware to steal cryptocurrency wallets. [...]

item.title: VSCode extensions with 9 million installs pulled over security risks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Microsoft has removed two popular VSCode extensions, 'Material Theme - Free' and 'Material Theme Icons - Free,' from the Visual Studio Marketplace for allegedly containing malicious code. [...]

item.title: PyPi package with 100K installs pirated music from Deezer for years
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A malicious PyPi package named 'automslc' has been downloaded over 100,000 times from the Python Package Index since 2019, abusing hard-coded credentials to pirate music from the Deezer streaming service. [...]
